name: Antiq Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful time at the Antiq Hotel. It is not too far from the main bus and train stations - about a 15 minute walk with our wheeled luggage.
reviews.title: Great Ljubljana Hotel

likes.disliked: — The budget room bed/mattress and the extreme heat in the room. Splurge on their other rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were disappointed with this hotel, and it did not live to the opinions we had prevously read. We stayed in room 7. An average size, but the bathroom was tiny and the door would not close easily. We had this problem with the door to the room aswell. The decorations of the room looked slightly unfinished with a wire going across the ceiling for the chandelier.
reviews.title: Not as impressive as we thought..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was enjoyable, but the room was crowded at times, and the childrens chairs/table sets werent the comfiest.
reviews.title: Charming hotel with interesting bathroom feature

likes.liked: — Central location, small size and value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were friendly and helpful with parking.
reviews.title: Great little hotel !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Touring Italy and Slovenia, we spent one night at the Antiq Hotel in July. It is a charming little hotel and very comfortable. When booking online, you are invited to choose your room from the list of all those available, each of which has its floor plan and details displayed. This is possibly one decision too many for the armchair trip planner to have to make! However we were very happy with the room we chose (number 5, overlooking the garden). One quaint feature of the room was that one wall of the bathroom is clear glass, so that whoever is in the bath or on the toilet can see (and be seen by) not only the other occupant of the room but also, if the curtains are open, whoever is in the garden. This was not a problem for us, but others might like to be warned. Despite large numbers of tourists in the town, our room was very quiet and peaceful, and we were able to park close to and within sight of the hotel. It was, however, very hot outside and the absence of air conditioning in our room was a bit of a drawback. Temperatures in Ljubljana rarely make air con a real necessity, though. Breakfast was tasty and copious, with the usual array of meat, cheese, eggs, cereal, fruit, bread, croissants and the slightly less usual squeeze-your-own orange juice. Daniel and Matjaz at reception were very helpful, and fed the parking meter for us in the morning. Lots of good places to eat within a couple of minutes walk.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, room 2 is disappointing

reviews.text: We would warmly recommend the Hotel Antiq and would certainly stay there again.
reviews.title: better than OK!

description: Nestled in the historic town centre of Ljubljana, the Antiq Hotel offers 16 charming guest rooms with views of the magnificent Ljubljana Castle or the romantic Gornji Trg square, this cosy boutique hotel is a peaceful haven just a stone-throw away from the busy cobble-stoned streets of the Old Town with its numerous cafes, restaurants and boutique stores.
